section.title: Reading Assignment
section.p: Read Sections 6.4 and 6.5 of Applied Discrete Structures. Although some relations can be computed (e. g. determining whether a \lt b), some are more efficiently represented in a matrix. We introduce the matrix representation of relations in Section 6.4, and then transitive closure in Section 6.5.

statement.p: Let p be the relation on people where x p y if y is either x's mother or father. What is \{z \mid x p^+ z\}, where p^+ is the transitive closure of p.
